DataElement.preferredName: Agent Disease or Disorder Dose Expansion Cohort C Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response for questions related to the use of agents that produce an effect, or that are intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient, as outlined in the study protocol, for patients registered in Dose Expansion Cohort C study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Agent Disease or Disorder Dose Expansion Cohort C Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._A group of subjects in a phase I trial, usually accrued after the maximum tolerated dose maximum tolerated dose has been established. These subjects, often with additional eligibility criteria, are used to: confirm that a safe level of drug exposure has been established, obtain preliminary evidence of efficacy, and identify specific patient subgroups that might derive particular benefits from the investigational treatment._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.

Property.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Dose Expansion Cohort Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:A group of subjects in a phase I trial, usually accrued after the maximum tolerated dose maximum tolerated dose has been established. These subjects, often with additional eligibility criteria, are used to: confirm that a safe level of drug exposure has been established, obtain preliminary evidence of efficacy, and identify specific patient subgroups that might derive particular benefits from the investigational treatment.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

A group of subjects in a phase I trial, usually accrued after the maximum tolerated dose maximum tolerated dose has been established. These subjects, often with additional eligibility criteria, are used to: confirm that a safe level of drug exposure has been established, obtain preliminary evidence of efficacy, and identify specific patient subgroups that might derive particular benefits from the investigational treatment.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: For patient registered to Dos
ReferenceDocuments.description: For patient registered to Dose Expansion Cohort C, does patient have: 1) have progression of disease on a 3rd generation EGFR-TKI such as AZD9291, rociletinib, HM61713. 2) be treatment naïve to an EGFR monoclonal antibody, 3) biopsy of tumor taken after progression on last EGFR-TKI must have lost EGFR-T790M (EGFR-T790M negative) confirmed by central testing prior to treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: For patient registered to Dose Expansion Cohort C, does patient have: 1) progression of disease on a 3rd generation EGFR-TKI such as AZD9291, rociletinib, HM61713, 2) be treatment naïve to an EGFR monoclonal antibody, 3) have a biopsy of tumor taken after progression on last EGFR-TKI that indicates preservation of EGFR-T790M post-progression on 3rd generation EGFR-TKI with biopsy confirmation by central testing prior to treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled to the Dose Expansion Cohort, has patient been previously exposed to immune checkpoint inhibitors in the metastatic setting?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: For the expansion cohorts only: If patient is in group A did patient have less than complete response (CR) or Deauville score of 3 at D90 (or before) after standard of care chimeric antigen receptor (CAR) T-cell therapy; If in group B, other patients with relapsed/refractory after 1 or more prior lines of therapy (e.g. relapse after Day 90 from CAR-T, or relapsed after other therapies and were not considered candidates for CAR-T or autologous hematopoietic cell transplantation)?
